title: Rape victim confronts Harvey Weinstein at comedy gig as he's labelled 'Freddy Krueger'
text:

Disgraced movie mogul Harvey Weinstein was confronted at a comedy night by a performer and an audience member over allegations he is a sexual predator.

Comedian Kelly Bachman was on stage when she spotted the Hollywood producer in the crowd.

She began attacking Weinstein, 67, over the allegations he abused dozens of women, leading some telling her to “shut up”.

“I'm feeling a little tense. Anyone else? I'm a comic, and it's our job to name the elephant in the room. Do we know what that is?” she said.

“It's a Freddy Krueger in the room if you will.

“I didn't know we had to bring our own mace and rape whistles.”

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)



Several men in the audience can be heard booing before one told her to “shut up”.

“Oh, shut up?' Bachman replied with her mic still in hand.

“This kills at group therapy for rape survivors.”

As others in the audience leapt to her defence, she added: “I have been raped. Surprisingly by no one in this room! I never got to confront those guys, so just a general f **k you.”

(Image: Zoe Stuckless)

(Image: Kelly Bachman)

Another woman at the Downtime Bar in Manhattan on Wednesday night also confronted the millionaire.

Zoe Stuckless stood in front of Weinstein shouting: “I'm gonna stand four feet from a f**king rapist and no one's gonna say anything?”

Stuckless said she was later kicked out from the bar, which was hosting Actors Hour, a ticketed event advertised as a “speakeasy for artists”.

(Image: Zoe Stuckless)



Weinstein, who is accused of sexual misconduct against some 70 women, remained seated during the attack.

At the time he was sat with “young, beautiful women and a posse of men around him”. A spokesman for Weinstein later said of the incident that is “was uncalled for, downright rude and an example of how due process today is being squashed by the public, trying to take it away in the courtroom too.”

He currently faces criminal charges of predatory sexual assault, criminal sexual act, first-degree rape and third-degree rape, to which he has pleaded not guilty.



Weinstein maintains that all sexual encounters he's been involved in have been consensual.

The trial is expected to begin in January.
description: The disgraced movie mogul was confronted by comedian Kelly Bachman after she saw him in the audience
